subject: Home & DIY
title: Lead Paint and the Childhood IQ Crisis
description: A short lesson to help you apply Lead Paint and the Childhood IQ Crisis.

hook.text: Homes built before 1978 likely contain lead paint. When it chips and becomes dust, children eat and inhale it.

buildup.text: Lead damages the developing brain for life. Even low exposure cuts IQ, causes behavioral issues, and impairs learning.

discovery.text: Lead paint tastes sweetâ€”children are attracted to paint chips. Toddlers who mouth windowsills ingest the highest doses.

twist.text: Sanding or scraping lead paint without containment creates toxic dust that persists in carpets and soil for decades.

climax.text: Painting over lead paint encapsulates it safely. Removal is riskier than sealing unless the surface is crumbling.

punchline.text: Sweet-tasting paint stole IQ points for decades.

quiz.question: Why are young children especially vulnerable to lead paint?
options: They mouth surfaces, and lead paint chips taste sweet
Their skin absorbs lead at a higher rate than adults
They spend more time outdoors near exterior paint
